original_context: Shiloh is not able to evade threats.
Shiloh does not hide from predators.
If Shiloh navigates currents, then he either explores depths or finds food, but not both.
If Shiloh either changes color or shifts scales (but not both), then he is able to evade threats.
If a fish darts fast, then it finds food and avoids obstacles.
If Shiloh either changes color or has camouflage (but not both), then he hides from predators.
Every fish that thrives in its environment either has camouflage or adapts quickly (or both).
For all fish, if they are intelligent and live in coral, then they thrive in their environment.
Shiloh either school swims or darts fast.
If Shiloh either school swims or is social (but not both), then he is intelligent.
conclusion: Shiloh is either social or defensive (or both).

google/gemini-2.5-pro-preview.mistake: In the fourth listed FOL-NL pair, the FOL statement `∀x ((¬p_10(x) ∨ p_14(x)) ∧ (¬p_10(x) ∨ p_15(x)))` does not correctly correspond to the NL statement "For all fish, (if a fish does not dart fast, then it finds food) and (if a fish does not dart fast, then it avoids obstacles)". Specifically, the FOL sub-expression `¬p_10(x) ∨ p_14(x)` is equivalent to `p_10(x) → p_14(x)` (If a fish darts fast, then it finds food). However, the NL sub-expression "if a fish does not dart fast, then it finds food" translates to `¬p_10(x) → p_14(x)`. The antecedents of the implication (`p_10(x)` vs `¬p_10(x)`) are different, leading to distinct logical meanings.

openai/gpt-4.1.mistake: None. All FOL statements correspond properly to the NL statements based on the context mapping.

openai/o4-mini-high.mistake: Used ¬p₁₀ ∨ p₁₄ to represent “if ¬p₁₀ then p₁₄,” but ¬p₁₀ ∨ p₁₄ is actually p₁₀ → p₁₄. The implication’s direction is reversed.
